fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.processors.interfaces

Interface ProcessorStaticStateI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, java.io.Serializable, TimeStampingI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProcessorStaticState

    public interface ProcessorStaticStateI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, TimeStampingI
    The interface ProcessorStaticStateI gives access to the static state information of processors transmitted by data interfaces of processors and computers.

    Description

    The interface is used to type objects pulled from or pushed by a processor using a data interface in pull or push mode. It gives access to static information, that is information that will not change during the whole existence of the processor.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 7, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
